intro: Vernonia bullata, commonly known as the silverleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features include a robust root system and a tall, erect stem. Vernonia bullata is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in moist environments.
